actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, September 19, 2024,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, September 19, 2024, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Amdt. 3292 (Sen. Peters):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Senate vitiated previous adoption of amendement SA 3292, not withstanding passage of S. 4698, under the order of 9/23/24.


 S.Amdt. 3293 (Sen. Peters):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Amendment SA 3293 proposed by Senator Durbin for Senator Peters.

        --Amendment SA 3293 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 S.Res. 838 (Sen. Shaheen):
        A resolution expressing support for the designation of November 17, 2024, as "National Warrior Call Day" and recognizing the importance of connecting warriors in the United States to support structures necessary to transition from the battlefield, especially peer-to-peer connection.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 839 (Sen. Moran):
        A resolution designating September 2024 as "National Student Parent Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 840 (Sen. Schatz):
        A resolution supporting the designation of the week of September 15 through September 21, 2024, as "Telehealth Awareness Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 841 (Sen. Manchin):
        A resolution designating September 2024 as "National Childhood Cancer Awareness Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 842 (Sen. Grassley):
        A resolution designating the week beginning October 20, 2024, as "National Character Counts Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 843 (Sen. Hickenlooper):
        A resolution designating October 2024 as "National Learning Disabilities Awareness Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 844 (Sen. Crapo):
        A resolution recognizing and supporting the goals and ideals of National Forensic Science Week.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN1399:
        Rose E. Jenkins, of the District of Columbia, to be a Judge of the United States Tax Court for a term of fifteen years

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 69 - 17. Record Vote Number: 249 



 PN1902:
        Byron B. Conway, of Wisconsin, to be United States District Judge for the Eastern District of Wisconsin

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Schumer, at  6:27 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
